name: Test frequency - Prior to work starting

Test frequency - Prior to work starting
Method/Description - Temporary Works Design Engineer to sign off permit to load prior to loading
Test frequency - Prior to works commencing
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Permit to Load
Test frequency - At least 1 week prior to work starting
Test frequency - Before construction and as necessary until the end of works.
Method/Description - Contractor to provide adequate notice to enable DSR inspections
Method/Description - Confirmation of tremie sizing as outlined in section 2.1.5.2 of the specification.
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Record
Method/Description - Contractor to complete detailed design of temporary casings
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Record
Method/Description - Concrete mix design(s) shall be submitted to the Design Engineer in writing at least 1 week prior to placing concrete and approved before placing concrete
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Mix Design Certificate
Method/Description - Steel Reinforcement shall comply with AS/NZS 4671 & NZS3109 and shall be the grade called up on the drawings
Test frequency - Prior to ordering steel
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Mill Certificates, Detail Sheets
Method/Description - Any welding or mechanical splicing to be approved in writing by the Design Engineer
Test frequency - Prior to welding or splicing
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - As-Built
Method/Description - 100% Visual Scanning of all welds
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Weld Inspection Report
Method/Description - Any reinforcement requiring cutting or bending on site to be approved in writing by the Design Engineer
Test frequency - Prior to cutting or bending onsite
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Approved RFI
Method/Description - Pile casings shall be stacked on suitable supports on firm ground
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Approved RFI

Method/Description - The concreting methodology shall be reviewed in advance by the Engineer, who will require to be satisfied that the method of placing and the concrete mix design will result in concrete fully compacted in place, possessing the specified strength and having the necessary density, integrity and durability.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Approved RFI
Method/Description - Vibe temporary casing to rock level, Extract Casing immediately following concrete pour.
○ Sufficient quanitity of concrete to be mainted with in the casing during removal to ensure external pressures are exceeded
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Check drilling performance, verticality and position. Drilling equipment must be capable of drilling into inclined rock surface
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Inspect pile bore condition, pile depth, rock socket length, toe level and ground water level.
○ No Pile shall be left open for greater then 24 hrs; pile borehole to be checked and cleaned if open more than 12 hrs; Concreting shall be done on the same day
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record

Method/Description - Each bored pile excavation shall be inspected by a Geotechnical Site Representative to ensure that the material at the base of the pile complies with the design requirements (i.e. founded in Mt Messenger Formation rock). The pile construction record shall be signed by the Geotechnical Site Representative to say the inspection has taken place and that the founding stratum meets the design requirements.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - All loose material to be removed from the bore using appropriate methods. Details of cleaning equipment to be submitted to the DSR at least 7 days prior to use onsite
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Approved RFI Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Base Hardness Test to be undertaken immediately prior to placement of reinforecemnt cage.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record

Method/Description - Observation of geotechnical conditions encountered and confirmation of key design assumptions. Contractor to inform designer at least 1 day in advance where pile observations will be required.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Visual Inspection to check supply and installation of reinforcement cage.
○ Confirm cages have been supplied as per detail sheets.
○ Confirm Grade, Size, spacing, lap lengths and weld postions are as per IFC drawings
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Detail Sheets, Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - DSR to inspect and sign off each pile prior to concreting
○ Visual check of socket cleanliness inf dry
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - All concrete delivered to site shall be produced strictly in accordance with the approved mix design
○ Concrete dockets checked for correct mix and concrete site testing undertaken.
○ One set of 3 cylinders to be taken for each set of poured piles
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Concrete Dockets, Bored Pile Record, Concrete Test Results
2.2.4 - Concrete Placement - Placing concrete under water
○  the depth of water at the base of the pile at the commencement of concrete placement exceed 75 mm; or
○   the inflow of water exceeds 200 mm of bore depth per hour; or

○   the use of drilling fluid prove necessary to maintain excavation stability,then concrete shall be placed using a tremie and a methodology that meets the appropriate requirements which are stipulated in this specification and the recommendations that are described in the publication “Recommended Practice Tremie Concrete for Deep Foundations (CIA, 2012) and/or Guide to Tremie Concrete for Deep Foundations (EFFC/DFI, 2018)”.
Method/Description - Concrete height to be no greater than 10m.
○ Concreting of piles shall be carried out continuously so no segregation occurs.
○ No concrete shall be placed when there is any danger of adverse weather causing damage to plastic or partially set concrete due to movement of pile casings.
Method/Description - Complete Survey of Wet concrete level to ensure pile is poured to correct height
○ Confirm finish is as per IFC Drawings
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Reinforcement cage to be adequately supported at all times during construction
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Bored Pile Record
Method/Description - Survey final position and top R.L. of each pile, produce As-Built drawings including stated measurements of pile lengths; record bedrock level
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - As-Built
Method/Description - Draewings updated to reflect any changes during construction
○ Any RFI's and NCR's noted on drawings and closed out prior to drawing re-issue
Test frequency - On Completion of Works
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Red-Line As-Built
